mandatory_config.timeline_description: Nelson Mandela, who led South Africa passed away on Dec. 5, 2013. He was 95. Mandela’s remarkable life changed history and its legacy resonates around the world.

single_event.message: Rolihlahla Dalibhunga Mandela is born in Mvezo, South Africa. One of 13 children, he was the eldest child of his father’s third wife. A teacher later gave him the name Nelson.
Mandela and Oliver Tambo found South Africa’s first black-run law firm.
single_event.media_caption: Mandela in the office of Mandela and Tambo

single_event.message: Mandela is arrested and charged with high treason along with 155 other activists, all of whom are eventually acquitted. The trials of the last 30 defendants, including Mandela, did not end until March 29, 1961.
